Guidelines for Product Images for B2B Commerce for Visualforce

Enrich your product listings with images optimized for different parts of the storefront experience.

REQUIRED EDITIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)
Minimum Required Images for a Product

To support a consistent user experience for every product on your storefront, add CC Product Media records with the following Media Type values.

Product Image
The default and largest image that displays on the Product Detail page.
Product Search Image
The scaled-down image that displays in results on the Product List page. Use a smaller version of your Product Image.
Product Image Thumbnail
The scaled-down image that displays in the following parts of the storefront. Use a smaller version of your Product Image.
On the Product Detail page (when you also set up alternate images)
In the shopping cart
In wish lists
During checkout
Alternate Images

To supplement your primary product image with different angles, detailed close-ups, or other renderings, add CC Product Media records with the following Media Type values.

Alternate Image
A full-sized image that replaces the primary Product Image (1) on the Product Detail page when a user hovers the cursor over an Alternate Image Thumbnail.
Alternate Image Thumbnail
A thumbnail (3) that displays next to the Product Image Thumbnail (2) on the Product Detail page.

You can add multiple alternate images and their thumbnails. To control the order of thumbnails, specify a Sequence value on each CC Product Media where Media Type is Alternate Image Thumbnail. Lower sequence values display first.

SVG Interactive Diagrams

To show an interactive Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) image for a product, select SVG Interactive Diagram from the Media Type picklist. You can use SVG diagrams with any product type, but the assembly type is optimized for using SVG diagrams to show component products in an assembly.

NOTE The only Product Media Source option that's compatible with SVG diagrams is Static Resource.
Image Sources

You can reference the source file for a product image in several ways:

Reference a file from a Content Delivery Network (CDN).
Reference a file from an uploaded static resource.
Attach a file directly to the CC Product Media record.

Learn more about the pros and cons of each source option.

Image File Sizes and Dimensions

If you attach an image file directly to a record or reference a file included in a static resource, Salesforce file size limits apply.

Optimize the dimensions and resolution of your image source files to fit your storefront's theme. For a reference point for your custom theme, set up a storefront with the demo Capricorn Coffee theme. Use your browser's console window to inspect the image dimensions and CSS rules applied to images. You can also download the demo Capricorn Coffee theme.

Accessibility for Images

To specify the value of an image's alt attribute in the page HTML, enter a value in the product media record's AltMessage field.

Consistently specifying alt text helps ensure that screen readers can describe your storefront content. Search engine bots can also consume the alt text when crawling and indexing your storefront.

To specify a tooltip string that displays when a buyer hovers over an image, enter a value in the product media record's Product Description field.

Locale for Images

If your storefront supports multiple locales, you have the following options:

Use the same image for every locale. Use your storefront's default locale for the Locale field. B2B Commerce for Visualforce falls back to the default locale's product media unless a locale-specific product media exists.
Use a unique image for a specific locale. Specify a non-default locale in the Locale field.
Add a Product Image from a Content Delivery Network
You can reference an image file served from a central file repository, such as content delivery network (CDN), using a uniform resource identifier (URI). We recommend this option for your image files whenever possible because it's the easiest way to maintain your images from a single managed location.
Add a Product Image from a Static Resource
You can reference an image file included in a static resource when specifying the image for a product. You can bundle multiple image files together in a single static resource, and reference the static resources across multiple records.
Attach a Product Image Directly to a Record
You can attach an image file directly to a CC Product Media record.
